<div class="section-card">
  <h2>ü§™ Random Moments</h2>
  <p>The completely unexpected, wonderfully weird moments that make life interesting and definitely worth documenting.</p>
  
  <div class="blog-post">
    <h3>When Your Dog Becomes a Social Media Star</h3>
    <div class="blog-meta">Beach cleanup ‚Ä¢ 2024</div>
    <p>My dog's kelp-eating antics somehow became the unofficial mascot of our beach cleanup group. Now people bring her seaweed as "treats" and she's basically a local celebrity. I never thought I'd be known as "the kelp dog's human" but here we are.</p>
  </div>
  
  <div class="blog-post">
    <h3>The Great Lab Coffee Spill of 2024</h3>
    <div class="blog-meta">UCSB Research Lab ‚Ä¢ 2024</div>
    <p>In a moment of pure clumsiness, I managed to spill coffee on my laptop, my research notes, and somehow my dog (who was visiting the lab). The result? A three-hour cleanup session, a very caffeinated dog, and a new rule about no beverages near the computers.</p>
  </div>
  
  <div class="blog-post">
    <h3>When Beach Cleanup Turns Into a Dance Party</h3>
    <div class="blog-meta">Isla Vista Beach ‚Ä¢ 2024</div>
    <p>What started as a serious environmental cleanup somehow evolved into a spontaneous dance party on the beach. Someone brought a speaker, the sunset was perfect, and suddenly we were all dancing while holding trash bags. Sometimes the best moments are completely unplanned.</p>
  </div>
</div>

<div class="section-card">
  <h2>üì± Behind the Scenes</h2>
  <p>The reality behind the photos: failed attempts, ridiculous outtakes, and the moments that never made it to social media.</p>
  
  <div style="background: var(--bg-light); padding: 2rem; border-radius: 10px; margin: 2rem 0;">
    <h4>Confessions of a Chronic Over-Photographer</h4>
    <p>I take approximately 47 photos of every "candid" moment. My phone storage is 80% blurry dog photos, 15% failed selfies, and 5% actual good pictures. But hey, that's what makes life interesting!</p>
    
    <h4>The Truth About Beach Cleanups</h4>
    <p>Yes, we're saving the environment. But we're also mostly just people who really like being at the beach and found a socially acceptable way to spend all day there. The environmental impact is a happy bonus.</p>
    
    <h4>Lab Life Reality Check</h4>
    <p>Research is 10% breakthrough moments, 20% actual work, and 70% trying to figure out why your code worked yesterday but doesn't work today. Also, a lot of coffee.</p>
